item.title: How to share your data online with OSF
item.description: ####Disclaimer: In the time I spent writing up this blog post, Courtney Soderberg published a tutorial manuscript for data sharing on OSF in the journal AMPPS. I highly recommend checking it out! Intro The Open Science movement is here to stay. Journals, reviewers, and fellow scientists increasingly expect that data and materials from research findings be made available upon publication. There are very good reasons for this, as open data and materials have the potential to increase reproducibility and collaboration, reduce the cost of data collection, and shift the focus from single findings to cumulative research programs.
